gbvision.gui.camera_window module¶

class gbvision.gui.camera_window.CameraWindow(window_name: str, wrap_object: gbvision.utils.readable.Readable, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.gui.readable_window.ReadableWindow

a basic window that displays a feed from a camera in this class, self.wrap_object will be of type Camera

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions module¶

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions.draw_circles(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray], circs: List[Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Union[int, float]]], color: Tuple[int, int, int], *args, **kwargs) → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

draws all circles on a copy of the frame and returns the copy

Parameters

  • frame – the frame to draw on

  • circs – the circles to draw

  • color – the color to draw in

  • args – all extra args to opencv’s circle (for example thickness)

  • kwargs – all extra keyword args to opencv’s circle (for example thickness)

Returns

a copy of the frame, after drawing

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions.draw_contours(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray], cnts: List[numpy.ndarray], color: Tuple[int, int, int], *args, **kwargs) → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

draws all contours on a copy of the frame and returns the copy

Parameters

  • frame – the frame to draw on

  • cnts – the contours to draw

  • color – the color to draw in

  • args – all extra args to opencv’s drawContours (for example thickness)

  • kwargs – all extra keyword args to opencv’s drawContours (for example thickness)

Returns

a copy of the frame, after drawing

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions.draw_ellipses(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray], ellipses: List[Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], float]], color: Tuple[int, int, int], *args, **kwargs) → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

draws all contours on a copy of the frame and returns the copy

Parameters

  • frame – the frame to draw on

  • ellipses – the ellipses to draw

  • color – the color to draw in

  • args – all extra args to opencv’s ellipse (for example thickness)

  • kwargs – all extra keyword args to opencv’s ellipse (for example thickness)

Returns

a copy of the frame, after drawing

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions.draw_rects(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray], rects: List[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]], color: Tuple[int, int, int], *args, **kwargs) → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

draws all rects on a copy of the frame and returns the copy

Parameters

  • frame – the frame to draw on

  • rects – the rects to draw

  • color – the color to draw in

  • args – all extra args to opencv’s rectangle (for example thickness)

  • kwargs – all extra keyword args to opencv’s rectangle (for example thickness)

Returns

a copy of the frame, after drawing

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions.draw_rotated_rects(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray], rotated_rects: List[Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], float]], color: Tuple[int, int, int], *args, **kwargs) → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

draws all rotated rects on a copy of the frame and returns the copy

Parameters

  • frame – the frame to draw on

  • rotated_rects – the rotated rects to draw

  • color – the color to draw in

  • args – all extra args to opencv’s drawContours (for example thickness)

  • kwargs – all extra keyword args to opencv’s drawContours (for example thickness)

Returns

a copy of the frame, after drawing

gbvision.gui.drawing_functions.draw_text(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray], text: str, coords: Tuple[int, int], font_scale: Union[int, float], color: Tuple[int, int, int], font=0, *args, **kwargs) → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

draws the text on a copy of the frame and returns the copy

Parameters

  • frame – the frame to draw on

  • text – the text to draw

  • coords – the coordinates of the bottom-left corner of the text

  • font_scale – the size of the drawn text (multiplied by the default size of the font)

  • color – the color to draw the text in

  • font – the font, an opencv font constant, default is cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX

  • args – additional arguments to cv2.putText

  • kwargs – additional keyword arguments to cv2.putText (such as thickness)

Returns

a copy of the frame with the text drawn on it

gbvision.gui.drawing_tools module¶

class gbvision.gui.drawing_tools.DrawCircles(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], color: Tuple[int, int, int], contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, circle_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.gui.drawing_tools._DrawObject

a pipeline that draws all circles according to the given parameters, and returns a copy of the frame after drawing

gbvision.gui.recording_camera_window module¶

class gbvision.gui.recording_camera_window.RecordingCameraWindow(window_name: str, wrap_object, file_name: str, fps=20.0, exit_button='qQ', drawing_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, recording_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, width=0, height=0)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.gui.recording_readable_window.RecordingReadableWindow, gbvision.gui.camera_window.CameraWindow

gbvision.gui.recording_feed_window module¶

class gbvision.gui.recording_feed_window.RecordingFeedWindow(window_name: str, file_name: str, fps=20.0, exit_button='qQ', drawing_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, recording_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, width=0, height=0, flags=256)[source]¶

gbvision.gui.recording_opencv_window module¶

class gbvision.gui.recording_opencv_window.RecordingOpenCVWindow(window_name: str, file_name: str, fps=20.0, exit_button='qQ', drawing_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, recording_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, width=0, height=0, flags=256)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.gui.opencv_window.OpenCVWindow, gbvision.gui.recording_window.RecordingWindow

Parameters

  • file_name – the name of the output file

  • drawing_pipeline – optional, a pipeline of drawing functions that will run on the frame before displaying it

  • exit_button – an array of keys (a string), when one of the keys are pressed the window will be closed

  • window_name – the title of the window

  • fps – the fps of the video file

  • recording_pipeline – optional, a drawing pipeline to run on the frames being recorded

gbvision.gui.window module¶

class gbvision.gui.window.Window(window_name: str, drawing_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

an abstract window class

Parameters

  • window_name – the title of the new window

  • drawing_pipeline – optional, a pipeline that draws on each frame before displaying it

close()[source]¶

closes the window

is_opened() → bool[source]¶
Returns

True is the window is opened, False otherwise

open()[source]¶

opens the window

show_frame(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → bool[source]¶

shows the frame on the window :param frame: the frame to show :return: false if the window was closed, true otherwise

gbvision.gui.wrapper_opencv_window module¶

class gbvision.gui.wrapper_opencv_window.WrapperOpenCVWindow(window_name: str, wrap_object, exit_button='qQ', drawing_pipeline=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, flags=256)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.gui.opencv_window.OpenCVWindow, gbvision.gui.wrapper_window.WrapperWindow, abc.ABC

a basic window that displays a feed from a camera

Parameters

  • wrap_object – the object from which to read the frame

  • drawing_pipeline – optional, a pipeline of drawing functions that will run on the frame before displaying it

  • exit_button – an array of keys (a string), when one of the keys are pressed the window will be closed

  • window_name – the title of the window

gbvision.gui.wrapper_window module¶

Bases: gbvision.gui.window.Window, abc.ABC

show()[source]¶

reads from the wrap object and shows the frame until the window is closed

show_and_get_frame() → Optional[numpy.ndarray][source]¶

shows one frame and returns it

Returns

the frame if the window was not closed, None otherwise

show_async()[source]¶

opens the steam video window on another thread
